title: Web-Based Experimental·Theoretical Integrated Curriculum for Supporting Academic Transition of Adult Science Learners

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level basic science knowledge (use of laboratory equipment, variable control methods, understanding of basic chemical reaction equations) and scientific observation/analysis skills
context.additional_context: A blended curriculum combining real-time video lectures (experiment demonstrations and discussions) with web-based self-directed learning (virtual lab simulations, data analysis tools) in smartphone-limited settings. Systematic training from experimental design to evidence-based conclusions, emphasizing scientific reasoning and problem-solving skills.

learning_goals: By the end of the 1-week course, learners explain five core scientific concepts required in vocational settings (e.g., thermodynamics laws, electrical circuit analysis, chemical reaction calculations) using scientific inquiry methods, design experiments with variables for three work-related scenarios, and demonstrate evidence-based conclusions through a summative exam (70%+ score) and practical assignment (3+ points/5 on rubric)
Learners conduct self-directed inquiry learning on web-based platforms to perform measurement data analysis, hypothesis verification, experimental procedure review, and advanced research

Learners collaborate with two peers using real-time tools (Figma/Miro) to complete a 3-phase (proposal-experiment-report) science experiment design project using recycled materials, achieving 4+ points out of 5 on the evaluation rubric

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
